questions.question: How many hearts does an octopus have?
questions.explanation: An octopus has three hearts. Two branchial hearts pump blood to the gills, while the third systemic heart pumps oxygenated blood to the rest of the body.

questions.question: Which animal has the longest lifespan of any mammal?
questions.explanation: The bowhead whale can live over 200 years, making it the longest-lived mammal. The Galápagos tortoise, while long-lived, is a reptile, not a mammal.

questions.question: What is a group of flamingos called?
questions.explanation: A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance, a fitting name given their striking pink plumage and dramatic group displays.

questions.question: Which is the only mammal capable of true sustained flight?
questions.explanation: Bats are the only mammals capable of true sustained flight. Flying squirrels, sugar gliders, and colugos can only glide, not truly fly.

questions.question: How far can a wolf howl be heard under ideal conditions?
questions.explanation: Under ideal conditions, a wolf's howl can be heard up to 10 miles (16 km) away. Wolves howl to communicate with pack members and mark territory.

questions.question: Which animal's fingerprints are virtually indistinguishable from human fingerprints?
questions.explanation: Koala fingerprints are so similar to human fingerprints that they can be confused even under a microscope. This is a remarkable case of convergent evolution.

questions.question: What color is a polar bear's skin underneath its white fur?
questions.explanation: A polar bear's skin is actually black, which helps absorb heat from the sun. Their fur appears white but is actually transparent and hollow.

questions.question: Which bird can fly backwards?
questions.explanation: Hummingbirds are the only birds that can fly backwards. Their unique ball-and-socket shoulder joint allows their wings to rotate 180 degrees, enabling flight in any direction.

questions.question: How long can a crocodile go without eating?
questions.explanation: Crocodiles can survive up to 2 years without eating. Their cold-blooded metabolism allows them to conserve energy remarkably well during periods of food scarcity.

questions.question: Which animal has the highest blood pressure of any living creature?
questions.explanation: The giraffe has the highest blood pressure of any animal, about twice that of humans. This is necessary to pump blood up its long neck to its brain.

questions.question: What percentage of a cat's bones are in its tail?
questions.explanation: About 10% of a cat's bones are in its tail. A cat's tail typically contains 19 to 23 vertebrae, while their entire body has about 230 bones.

questions.question: Which insect can carry objects 50 times its own body weight?
questions.explanation: Ants can carry objects 50 times their own body weight. Their muscles are thicker relative to their body size compared to larger animals, giving them extraordinary strength.

questions.question: What is unique about a starfish's (sea star's) stomach?
options: It can push its stomach outside its body
questions.explanation: A sea star can push its stomach outside its body to digest food externally. It wraps its stomach around prey and digests it before pulling the stomach back inside.

questions.question: How many times per second can a housefly beat its wings?
questions.explanation: A housefly beats its wings approximately 200 times per second. This incredibly rapid wing movement is what produces the buzzing sound we hear.

questions.question: Which sea creature has the largest eyes in the animal kingdom?
questions.explanation: The colossal squid has the largest eyes in the animal kingdom, measuring up to 11 inches (27 cm) in diameter — about the size of a dinner plate. These enormous eyes help it see in the deep, dark ocean.
